intro: Oenone flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible oenone, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, often zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Oenone flexuosa is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
